results.title: The Reality of rape
results.creator_credit: Motorola Teleprograms and Averill M Kronick
results.brief_description: A young hitchhiker is picked up on her way to work. We then see a devastatingly powerful recreation of how a rapist “negotiates” for psychological control, as well as the violent act of rape itself. Subsequent scenes involve two officers of varying sensitivity, as they respond to the emotional needs of the victim before proceeding with the preliminary interview. Includes very realistic rape scenes.

results.title: The Realities of recycling
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and United States. Environmental Protection Agency
results.brief_description: Recycling our solid wastes is basic to the protection of our environment. It is the most important single principle which must be incorporated into tomorrow’s solid waste management systems to permit conservation of our resources and easy and economical solid waste disposal. Designed for leaders and technicians who need a more comprehensive grasp of the potential of recycling. Various forms of recycling systems are shown.

results.title: The Real Story of Captain Cook's Death
results.brief_description:
Captain Cook encounters new territory and claims it. He is attacked by a native of the island and so flees. The native gets subsequently eaten by a big fish.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Real Mobile
results.brief_description: Presents varied attractions of the city of Mobile, Alabama. Shows the city’s family life, historical background, beautiful gardens and includes shots of acrobatic water skiing, swimming, boating, tennis, golf and riding.

results.title: The Real Middle-Earth
results.creator_credit: Television New Zealand, Rustic Road Productions and David Mason
results.brief_description: Made for television, this documentary explores the New Zealand locations used in “The Lord of the Rings” trilogy by Peter Jackson. Television presenter Jim Hickey interviews locals who played extras in the films and those that were involved in the ‘behind-the scenes’ side of the business, such as caterers, horse wranglers, stuntmen, artists etc. Features an interview with Jackson discussing the way in which he used the lush New Zealand landscape as a stand-in for the Middle Earth of Tolkien’s iconic text.

results.title: The Real Jurassic Park
results.brief_description: The film ‘Jurassic Park’ captured the minds and imaginations of movie-goers worldwide. This compelling documentary investigates the scientific possibilities of recreating dinosaurs from stored genetic material. Discusses ethical and logistical issues such as food supply for creatures like Tyrannosaurus Rex which could consume the equivalent of a modern day elephant on a daily basis. Features expert commentary from some of the world’s leading palaentologists and will stimulate discussion on the critical issues associated with genetic engineering. Should we let sleeping dinosaurs lie?

results.title: The Real glory
results.brief_description: Set in 1906, a lonely outpost of American soldiers is left in Manila to train the Philippine Constabulary in the ways of war. They must prevent further uprisings from opposing tribes hidden in the jungle, or face continued oppression. An idealistic Doctor (Gary Cooper) clashes with the captain in charge (and the father of the woman he has fallen in love with), on how the native Moro’s can best be trained, and whether they should defend the outpost or take the battle to the jungle. As the water supply is sabotaged by the jungle tribe, the soldiers and Moros reliant on the precious water face a natural disaster as devastating as the tribal violence, cholera. Based on the novel by Charles L. Clifford. Cast includes Andrea Leeds, David Niven and Reginald Owen.

results.title: The Real Aussie video
results.creator_credit: Video Projects, Penny Robins and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: The story of an Asian boy and an Australian girl who are apprenticed into a marketing agency. Their differing backgrounds provide an expose of racism in Australia.
